intro: Erythroxylum ulei var. escalerense, commonly known as the Escalerense Erythroxylum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Erythroxylaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It produces small, elliptical berries that contain the seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
